name: ConceptMapR5ConditionElementsForR4Condition
title: Cross-version ConceptMap for FHIR R5 resources in FHIR R4
description: This ConceptMap represents the cross-version mapping of resource FHIR R5 for use in FHIR R4.

target.comment:
FHIR R5 Resource `Condition` is representable via FHIR R4 Resource `Condition`.
Element `Condition` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition`.
Element `Condition.meta` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.meta`.
Element `Condition.implicitRules` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.implicitRules`.
Element `Condition.language` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.language`.
Element `Condition.text` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.text`.
Element `Condition.contained` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.contained`.
Element `Condition.identifier` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.identifier`.

Note that the target element context `Condition.clinicalStatus` is a modifier element, so this extension does not need to be defined as a modifier.
Element `Condition.clinicalStatus` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.clinicalStatus`.
Element `Condition.verificationStatus` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.verificationStatus`.
Element `Condition.category` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.category`.
Element `Condition.severity` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.severity`.
Element `Condition.code` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.code`.
Element `Condition.bodySite` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.bodySite`.
Element `Condition.subject` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.subject`.
Element `Condition.encounter` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.encounter`.

Note that the target element context `Condition.onset[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Condition`.
Element `Condition.onset[x]` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.onset[x]`.
Note that the target element context `Condition.onset[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Condition`.

Note that the target element context `Condition.abatement[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Condition`.
Element `Condition.abatement[x]` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.abatement[x]`.
Note that the target element context `Condition.abatement[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Condition`.
Element `Condition.recordedDate` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.recordedDate`.
Element `Condition.participant` is will have a context of Condition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Condition`.

Element `Condition.participant.function` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Condition.participant` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Condition.participant.function` is will have a context of Condition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Condition`.

Element `Condition.participant.actor` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Condition.participant` requires a cross-version extension.
Note that there is an externally-defined extension that has been flagged as the representation of FHIR R5 element `Condition.participant.actor` with an unmapped Reference type: `http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/alternate-reference`.
Element `Condition.participant.actor` is will have a context of Condition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Condition`.
Element `Condition.stage` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.stage`.
Element `Condition.stage.summary` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.stage.summary`.
Element `Condition.stage.assessment` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.stage.assessment`.
Element `Condition.stage.type` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.stage.type`.
Element `Condition.evidence` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.evidence`.
Element `Condition.note` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Condition.note`.
